attributes.action: Change the methods the Government use to record Homelessness
attributes.background: The methods currently used by the Government to record Homelessness portray unrealistic results. Many people are concealed in the 'hidden homelessness' category as they sofa surf or move around on the streets. Current figures are an underestimate, many are not included in the official statistics.
attributes.additional_details: Many people who the average citizen would classify as homeless are neglected from the record as they do not fit Government criteria. We cannot ignore the lives of individuals simply because they are not "lying down in the street" and instead are hiding in the crevice of a doorway. If the Government change the way they record homelessness to give a more representative statistic, as a united country we can tackle this issue with full knowledge of what we are facing.

attributes.action: Mandatory for all alcoholic beverages to display nutritional information
attributes.background: I suffer with type 1 diabetes but want to lead a normal life. Identifying the total carbohydrate content of a beer from various internet searches is difficult and unreliable. Furthmore we have a nation of growing waistbands, shouldn't the calorific content of alcohol be visible to inform consumers?

attributes.action: Make it a crime to remove dairy calves' teats without anaesthetic & pain relief
attributes.background: Many dairy calves have extra or "supernumerary" teats removed with a scalpel or scissors. It is only "recommended" to provide anaesthetic. Not legally required to provide anaesthetic and pain relief medication afterwards
attributes.additional_details:
For more information see the following links
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235188/Welfare-sheet-Dairy-cows.pdf
http://adlib.everysite.co.uk/adlib/defra/content.aspx?id=000IL3890W.182WIKRB434ZN7
http://www.gov.scot/Publications/2009/06/18114130/10

attributes.action: Restrict child benefit to the first two children in a family
attributes.background: The population of the world generally and of the UK specifically is growing at an alarming rate. The government should not be subsidising parents who choose to have larger families. It is therefore proposed that child benefit should be capped at two children per family

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys from restaurant kids meals
attributes.background: As part of a concerted effort to reduce plastic consumption, we should tackle the easy target of removing the toys given as part of happy meals from restaurants such as McDonald's and Burger King. These toys could easily be replaced with something more educational and environmentally friendly.

attributes.action: Set up a Royal Commission to look into the funding model and use of the NHS
attributes.background: The funding model of the NHS has been a political football for decades, yet it is perhaps the more fundamental of services. Its funding is too important to be decided by the conflicting interests of political parties. It's use needs to be examined to decide whether its current use is sustainable

attributes.action: Ban private parking firms from operating within the NHS.
attributes.background: I recently had to spend a lot of time visiting my ill mother in hospital. It opened my eyes to the fact so many people have huge worries regarding parking to see to their loved ones as the cost is so high. The worst bit about it is not a penny was going back into the hospital but to a private firm.
attributes.additional_details:
The gov website states:
Charges should be reasonable for the area.
Concessions, including free or reduced charges or caps, should be available for the following groups:
Disabled people
Frequent outpatient attenders
Visitors with relatives who are gravely ill, or carers of such people
Visitors to relatives who have an extended stay in hospital, or carers of such people
Carers of people in the above groups where appropriate.
My recent visits of £18 per day is certainly not within these guidelines.

attributes.action: Increase the hourly funding rate for Early Years Education
attributes.background:
Early Years Funding is in Crisis!

National Living Wage is increasing by 4.4% in April.  Employer pension contributions are increasing to 2% at the same time.
Guess how much our funding has gone up by?
0%

Early years providers are closing, please sign and save FREE Early Years Education!
attributes.additional_details:
We have to sign a contract stating it is ILLEGAL for us to get parents to pay top ups to cover the short fall in funding.  Not that they should of course, as the government advertise it as FREE childcare after all!

No other business has what it can charge their customers dictated to them.  The government control what we receive and what we can charge and the result is a deficit for most providers.

Please help is get an increase in funding, in line with the increase of business costs.

attributes.action: To move Parliament to new buildings more suitable for 21st century Britain
attributes.background: To look at building a new Houses of Parliament, more suitable for a 21st century Britain, that shows clearly, MPs are public servants, elected by the people, to serve the people. The current premises are alien to a modern, successful country
attributes.additional_details: The current Houses of Parliament will make a fantastic British historic building to open up for the public, will pay for itself in visitors and events.

attributes.action: Change the 5p charge for plastic bags to 10p and replace with bags for life
attributes.background: The introduction of the 5p bag charge in 2015 reduced usage in England by 85% but there is still work to be done to minimise our negative impact on the environment, especially marine life. An increase would raise more money for charities and replacing single use with bags for life will reduce waste.
attributes.additional_details:
A ten week trial by Tesco to stop selling single use 5p carrier bags and offering 10p reusable bags for life recently saw a 25% reduction in bag sales as shoppers either brought their own or purchased the more expensive bag (made from 94% recyclable material). 

This move will help fewer bags needing to be sent to landfill while continuing to generate money from bag sales that goes directly to environmental charities.

attributes.action: Close the loophole that allows second home owners to evade council tax and rates
attributes.background:
In England, second home owners can avoid council tax by claiming to be a business if they say they are available for letting for 140 days a year - they do not have to actually let at all.
As their rateable value is below £12k, they also qualify for 100% small business rate relief - so pay nothing.
attributes.additional_details:
In Southwold, on the Suffolk coast, where most houses are second homes, this loophole costs the local council about half a million pounds every year in lost revenue because 257 of these homes claim to be a business and pay nothing. 
It is grossly unfair that people with two homes should be subsidized by people with no, or only one, home.
Most genuine businesses do not now qualify for small business rate relief because the latest revaluation has put them above the ceiling.

attributes.action: Make teaching coping mechanisms compulsory in secondary schools
attributes.background: At 8 years-old I lost my mum to cancer, and I'd never dealt with it until 20 years later, because I wasn't equipped with adequate coping mechanisms. Children everywhere are unequipped to deal with trauma they experience on a daily basis, and the stress of later life, I'd like to change that.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 British people suffer from mental health problems, and depression is 10x more widespread than it was just a decade ago (demonstrating its alarming growth under societal changes). 85% of adults experience stress on a regular basis; a cause of anxiety, depression, panic attacks and insomnia. Suicide is the biggest cause of death in men betweeh 20 - 49. And LGBT people are more likely to experience mental health problems, and less likely to have support systems.

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and put the money into road repairs and improvement.
attributes.background:
Pot holes are causing serious damage to vehicles and injury to road users such cyclists and motorcyclists. All are at serious risk.

So cancel HS2 with its budget of £15 billion and put the money to work right away on the roads. That will benefit more people than a high speed rail link.

attributes.action: Make mandatory that vehicle manufacturers install remotely activated immobiliser
attributes.background: To assist with vehicles that 'fail to stop' for police and being used as weapons in terror attacks, all vehicles should be fitted with remotely activated immobilisers which can be activated by authorities or owners if thier vehicle is stolen or used in crime.
attributes.additional_details: This will help prevent the many deaths we have seen in police pursuits and vehicles being used as weapons in recent terror attacks.

attributes.action: Ban plastic cotton buds
attributes.background: The sale and manufacture of plastic-stemmed cotton buds is to be banned under new Scottish government plans. England should follow suit as the plastic stems of cotton buds kill 1000s of marine species every year along the coastline.
attributes.additional_details: If the Scottish government can take action and ban plastic being used to make cotton buds so can we. People flush plastic cotton buds down the toilet and many end up in the ocean and as a result they are washed up on our beaches. Not only is this devastating for ecosystems but also for the health of our beautiful coastline. With alternatives such as paper cotton buds available, there is really no need to use plastic.

attributes.action: Help me to deport my little brother from a Singaporean prison back to the UK
attributes.background: In the November of 2016 19 year old Lorenzo Dentamaro, was arrested in Singapore on accusations of fraud. He spent 6 months on bail battling the case only to be made an example of and harshly served with 3 years inprisomment. He is currently in 16 man cell, suffering in 30 plus temperatures.
attributes.additional_details: My family is suffering, I have grandparents that are very old and may never have the opportunity to see him again. We have to travel 13 hours to see him for only 20 minutes and I just want to bring him back home so he can complete his sentence in the UK. My mother is depressed, our lives have been impacted serverely and I am constantly living on breaking point. I just want to bring him home.

attributes.action: Government to take the European Commission to the ECJ for misconstruing Art 50.
attributes.background: In Article 50 of the Treaty of Lisbon there is no mention of monetary reparation for leaving, continual jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice, continual rights of European citizens in the departing territory, or soft annexation of its sovereign territory
attributes.additional_details: Mr Juncker and Mr Barnier seem to want to penalise the UK because of Brexit. But the Treaty of Lisbon makes no particular obligations on leaving countries. If the Treaty envisaged continual supremacy of the ECJ over national courts after departure, or continual freedom of movement for European citizens in the departing country after departure it should have been a treaty provision rather than implied by latter day negotiators.

attributes.action: Change the law to make the sex offenders register public
attributes.background: Every few months we hear of another sex offender who’s been living in our area beside our kids and schools, our children are not safe to walk to school or play with friends because they keep them protected and not the people at real risk

attributes.action: Car Tax to start from the day you Tax your car and end the day you sell.
attributes.background: If someone buys a car from me mid month and they part exchange their old car they are losing out twice. This is because the new car tax is back dated to the beginning of the month, and the old car can only claim every complete month remaining!

attributes.action: The People's Mandate. Electorate vote on the agenda of next parliament.
attributes.background: Give the electorate a preliminary vote in the year before each General Election, that will allow them to choose the agenda of the next parliament & provide the political parties with a 'people's mandate' by which they design their manifestos to serve. For too long the word 'Mandate' has been abused.
attributes.additional_details: This 'Preliminary Vote' could be in the form of a list of government departments or pressing issues that the country faces. The electorate would vote on their top 3 priorities and this would be collated to provide the future government with a democratic mandate from which to form their manifestos. To date, the people get what they are given. With a preliminary vote on issues of importance the people get to be more involved in driving the political policy of the next parliament.

attributes.action: Make Government spending transparent, adjust funding "increases" for inflation
attributes.background: Often funding increases are announced, which amount to a funding cut after inflation. The only transparent approach is to deflate figures for inflation to give an increase figure in "real terms".
attributes.additional_details:
Full Fact provides evidence that the Grant review for police funding amounts to a cut after inflation.
https://fullfact.org/crime/police-funding-england-and-wales/

Conservatives say Labour voted against an increase.
https://www.facebook.com/conservatives/photos/a.288165009278.146725.8807334278/10155780194029279/?type=3&theater

Labour say Conservatives voted for a real terms cut.
https://www.facebook.com/labourparty/posts/10155283147077411

attributes.action: "Warning" labels on dog flea shampoos containing Pyrethrum as toxic to cats.
attributes.background: I washed my cat with dog flea shampoo. There was no warning label on the product. In small writing amongst other text it stated it should never be used on cats. Unfortunately, my beloved companion died 2 days later. This type of poisoning is not uncommon.
attributes.additional_details: The product I used was a standard dog flea shampoo purchased over the counter for my dog weeks beforehand, but I didn't think it would be harmful to my cat.  Clear, informed "Warning" labels should be on the front of such products indicating they are toxic to cats. This will hopefully prevent other cats from being harmed or dying as a result of the chemical Pyrethrum which they can't metabolise, yet dogs can.

attributes.action: Introduce new opportunities for medically failing applicants for the military.
attributes.background: Applicants who have applied and had their heart set on starting a military career with the correct attitude, fitness and skills who are turned away for, in some cases, minor or none apparent disabilities or injuries should be given more opportunities or choices.
attributes.additional_details: The modern military is diverse and equal such as allowing women to fight on the front lines but the the fact that you may not be allowed to serve on the front lines or for your country in any role due to a predicted adherent or minor issue has affected the majority of applying citizens. I understand that the military is required to uphold certain standards and a minimum level of fitness, qualities and skills from it's personnel depending on the various roles. However, when a potential candidate is not given the chance to prove their usefulness, or given any chance of finding their place in the military things need to changed or at the very least looked into.

attributes.action: Pressure the Cameroon government to organise a referendum in Southern Cameroons.
attributes.background: Southern Cameroon was a Trust territory of the UK with its mandate ending in 1961 where a Plebiscite was organised by the UN giving the people the option of either joining Cameroon/Nigeria to gain its independence.The present crisis in the region is a direct consequence of the failure that process
attributes.additional_details:
Britain has a key role to play in the present crisis in Southern Cameroons.On 1st October 2017 Southern Cameroons reasserted its independence from Cameroun. It now has an interim government and now recognizes itself as the Republic of Ambazonia.

The problem in Southern Cameroons is a consequence of failed decolonisation.UN resolution 1514 reaffirms the right of every people to self determination.Denial of that right or subjugation of a people to an alien power is a frequent cause of conflict.

attributes.action: Restore Nursing bursaries
attributes.background:
The shortage of nursing staff is adversely affecting patient care 
Scrapping nursing bursaries has affected the recruitment of nurses
Nursing is one of the most valuable professions , and should be supported in every way possible

attributes.action: Councils should be able to nominate people to a different council for downsizing
attributes.background: The Government should extend the Right to Move to tenants who want to downsize. There are so many council tenants under occupying properties that bigger families desperately need.
attributes.additional_details: All councils & housing associations should be giving tenants an incentive to move out of these bigger properties, like allowing a tenant to be nominated to a borough of the tenants choice. Local authorities shouldn’t be allowed to apply a local connection test if it could disadvantage tenants who need or want to move across local authority boundaries to downsize.

attributes.action: Bring forward the 2020 London Mayoral Elections to 2019.
attributes.background: The 2020 London mayoral elections should be brought forward from 2020 to 2019 in order to de-conflict with a possible general election also due 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The current London assembly is running with the idea that the election should be delayed until 2021 because of the chance of a general election in the same year (2020). This will give the current mayor an extra 12 months in power without being re-elected.

Londoners should be given the opportunity to select a new mayor sooner rather than later. The people of London must be given the chance to rid themselves of the massive increase in crime associated with the current mayor.

attributes.action: Make 'traffic light' food/drink labelling legally compulsory in the UK.
attributes.background:
One often reads, hears or sees in the news these days that obesity levels in the UK
have reached pandemic proportions,
leading to concerns about the risk of heart disease and diabetes, among other serious and life-changing illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: A big contributing factor is the amount of excess fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar consumed by the average UK citizen on a daily basis. There is a clear system available called the "traffic lights", whereby food and drink items can be rated using red (high), amber (medium) and green (low) images to simply and clearly indicate how much fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar are contained in 100 grams or 100 millilitres of an item. As I understand it use of the traffic lights is currently voluntary.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists filtering on blind side and apply 1.5m rule in all cases
attributes.background: Cyclist's are putting themselves in danger passing through tiny gaps on blind side where they are not seen by motorists and should abide by the 1.5m passing rule to avoid causing dangerous road conditions and damage to vehicles where cyclists aren't insured

attributes.action: - To send aid to the people of Yemen and raise awareness
attributes.background: There is a war, a war we have all forgotten about. The Yemeni civil war is crushing its people and causing all kinds of ill fate, from starvation, illnesses and death. This forgotten war cannot stay in the dark.

attributes.action: Stop the care cuts! We’re now behind Crisis point! We’re at the edge!
attributes.background: Residential care homes are closing at an unprecedented rate, hospitals are logjammed with elderly patients with nowhere to go; in the community, local authority cuts are leaving more than a million people desperately in need of more assistance in their homes.
attributes.additional_details: From a 19 year old girl that started care at the age of 18 I’m begging for you not to do any more cuts Every single year we face more and more difficulties proving quality care for the elderly and disabled, do you not realise how much pressure we are under? These people have seen more than you ever will have. In 40 years time when we’re old and frail WHO WILL HELP US? Who will be our support! please think about the long term effect this will have on people!

attributes.action: Fund the costs spent by the emergency services following the Manchester attack.
attributes.background: We call on the Government to honour its commitment to fully fund the costs spent by the emergency services and local authorities following the horrific Manchester attack.

attributes.action: Withhold all contractual payments to the EU untill a Brexit deal is reached.
attributes.background:
If the UK thrives after Brexit, the EU is doomed.

I believe that's why the EU is making things difficult, but, we too can make things difficult by withholding the huge amounts of money we pay them until a Brexit deal is reached.

EU members are allowed to leave. Thier behaviour is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Require labelling of all products which contain pig or its bye products
attributes.background: Lot of products edible or for human use are in the market which contain pig and its bye products without specifying. Jellies, soaps, breads and spreads etc. can contain lard or pig bones without specifying. This hurts lots of people’s sentiments and beliefs.

attributes.action: Please keep our Island Studio school OPEN in East Cowes Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
Do NOT CLOSE this school. 
If the current proprietors cannot or will not continue running it, then allow SOMEONE ELSE to run it.
We need diversity of opportunity.
But start at a lower age so children can choose to go to have their full secondary education at this school. Make it 11-19, not 14-19.

attributes.action: Build and repair road surfaces using the plastic waste produced in the UK
attributes.background: Households in the UK produce 22 million tonnes of waste per year and only 44% is recycled. Our country keeps exporting our waste (particularly plastic) to other far shores. Since China have introduced a ban against this, the government are searching for new places to export.
attributes.additional_details: The Netherlands have recently introduced the usage of recycled plastics in the re-surfacing and building of road surfaces. Not only does it recycle the waste that we create, but it also reduces CO2 damage caused by the original asphalt. This surface can withstand extreme temperatures from -40 degrees to 80 degrees. Many road surfaces desperately require repair and this is a quick, simple solution that forces our country to take responsibility for our negative environmental impact.

attributes.action: Proportional charge for all Governmental Fixed Penalty Notices and Fines.
attributes.background: We, the signed, call on the government to implement the same policy that is already practiced by  governments in other european countries such as Denmark and Iceland in which Fines are charged to a proportion of the offenders income. This way punishment is same for all, as it is meant to be in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Think about it this way 2 people walking down the road both drop litter and are given a fixed penalty notice of £80. The first person comes from a household earning £200 a week and the other £200 a day. This is not a fair measure, this nearly 7x worse for the person who can afford it the least.

A proportional system means both parties receive the same impact and that impact can be kept from being up to half the weekly income of people who are potentially facing growing poverty.

attributes.action: Parent and Child Parking Badge
attributes.background: There are motorists out there that park in parent and child parking spaces when they don't have children, then there is no spaces for those motorists that the are designed for.
attributes.additional_details: There should be a parking badge created for mortorists that are parents to be able to park in the parent & child spaces, working in the same way as the disabled badges. If a motorist wants one they should provide proof they have children (under 12 ) and they drive a car. The badge must have the license plate on so it can't be fraudaulantly used by anyone else. The government should create such a badge which must be renewed every time you get a new car.

attributes.action: Make up-skirt photography an illegal offence in the UK
attributes.background: Upskirting is the act of taking a photograph of underneath a person's skirt without their consent. It is often performed in a public place such as on public transport or on an escalator. Many women across the UK are targeted in places such as nightclubs, restaurants and shops. This needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details: In Scotland, Upskirting is an illegal offence, and has been since 2010. Victims and police are only able to pursue offences of voyeurism and indecency, with a Freedom of Information request made by the Press Association revealing that the police have pursued 78 offences related to upskirting since 2015 - but only 11 led to alleged offenders being charged.

attributes.action: Update the Fatal Accidents Act 1976 to help bereaved families.
attributes.background: The loss of a loved one following a fatal injury (accident or murder) drastically needs updating. We need to expand the number of family members who are entitled to a bereavement award and to increase the compensation which currently stands at £12,980. The  Law tells us who is entitled to claim.
attributes.additional_details:
Why does it need updating...? 

A wife can claim £12,980 for loss of her husband but nothing if she loses an adult child. If a child loses a parent, the child receives nothing. 

However celebrities can obtain over £200,000 for breach of privacy for phone hacking.

A person killed instantly in an accident or murdered is worth NOTHING.  

The cost of looking after a DOG is more than a bereavement award and more than life itself.

Please help bereaved families and children who have lost parents.

attributes.action: Make unpaid internships illegal, National Minimum Wage compulsory after 2 weeks.
attributes.background: Unpaid Internships are used by companies in the fashion & creative industry that are worth millions. This use of free labour is exploitative. It increases elitism and classism within the chosen roles and does not give everyone a fair chance to pursue their future career.
attributes.additional_details: In 2018 it is unbelievable that not just students, but graduates are forced to work for free for up to a year after graduating if they have selected an arts/fashion based subject. If these individuals do not live in London or have their parents to contribute to their income it can cost £1,019 monthly according to The Sutton Trust. The majority of these companies are worth millions and can afford labour at NMW. These individuals are exploited, with no income and no promise of future employment.

attributes.action: Make health workers exempt from parking tickets when delivering a public service
attributes.background: Allow domiciliary carers, emergency services, District nurses and doctors to park on single or double yellow lines when carrying out a health service for the public in their own homes.
attributes.additional_details: Care workers,District nurse,emergency services&doctors find it difficult to park when delivering a care service.if they display a notice,when parked on yellow lines, explaining they're there for a reason,they should be exempt from parking tickets within a certain time frame.The health services are under massive constraints&strains&are extremely limited to time,Parking issues need to be addressed. Councils pay for care to be delivered but penalise those very people when parking is unavailable.

attributes.action: There should be centrally funded, free, total and complete care for the elderly
attributes.background: I want to free the elderly from the huge burden of trying to fund their own care at the end of their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to free the local authority from the burden of trying to fund care of the elderly when they do not have the money
I want to free the families from the burden of having to make up any shortfall in funding in order to give their loved ones the complete care they need
I want to see some meaningful return for the taxes we have paid throughout our working lives
Finally, it is the mark of a civilised nation that the state safeguards and has a duty of care towards the elderly: the most vulnerable In our society

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to purposely waste ambulance time & resources.
attributes.background:
Recently an ambulance service rushed to attend to a man claiming to have had a stroke, only to find out he made it up so he could get a free lift. 

Unfortunately the service has said it has to deal with ‘day in day out’ and that unfortunately there is no law against wasting ambulance time.

attributes.action: Change the way the dangerous dogs act is administered
attributes.background: Instead of dogs being unfairly imprisoned based on a non confirmed act of aggression, have the authorities act upon this in a timely manner to prevent stress to the animal. This stress is unjustified and an act of cruelty towards animals where the animal where there is evidence to the contrary.
attributes.additional_details: I write this based on a personal experience where a family dog has been in custody of an animal shelter based on false allegations. There is evidence to show the allegations are false yet the authorities are not acting upon this in a timely manner. The stress this causes to an animal is astronomical and should be deemed as cruelty which is unlawful. I call for the government to place a time frame on when cases are heard in court or for legislation to be brought forward to review evidence sooner.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for teachers to search students' phones without consent.
attributes.background: Ever since 2011 it has been legal for teachers to search through students’ phones without the consent of the student. Students are human as well, and just because we are on school grounds does not mean we should lose our rights - unconsented searches are a complete violation of our rights to privacy
attributes.additional_details: Teachers can search through student’s phones with little more information than someone saying something to the teacher. This is completely ridiculous and happened recently at a school - where boys were forced to hand over their phones for the teacher to go through, despite the fact that what the teacher was insinuating had not happened and they had no more evidence to go through the phone other than a meaningless accusation. This is a violation of our privacy - and should not be allowed.

attributes.action: Make Greyhound racing illegal in the U.K .
attributes.background: Greyhound racing must be banned in the U.K. This "sport" remains legal in 8 countries and one of them is the U.K. The sport is inhumane and over 10,000 greyhounds vanish/die every year. This is why we believe it has to stop . #YouBetTheyDie #NoGreyhoundRacing
attributes.additional_details: Greyhound racing is a popular industry here in the U.K. Beautiful dogs race at ground-scaring speeds; the thrill making quick quid off a brutal bet - this all entices many dog-racing enthusiasts, betters and gamblers alike. However, the reality is greyhound-racing is cruel and disgusting. Over 10,000 greyhounds a year are tossed aside due to being "useless". Around 8,000 of these are retired. These poor dogs are then left to starve, abandoned, murdered, sold for dissection purposes and worse.

attributes.action: Change the Numeracy and Literacy Skills Tests to unlimited attempts
attributes.background: All trainee teachers have to sit numeracy and literacy skills tests in order to achieve Qualified Teacher Status. This should be changed from 3 attempts to unlimited attempts. Currently after 3 failed attempts the candidate cannot take these tests again for another 2 years.
attributes.additional_details: Each question from the mathematics section is timed putting a huge amount of pressure on trainee teachers. The maths and literacy skills tests should be revised and adapted depending on the age of the children the candidate wants to work with. For example primary and secondary trainee teachers should sit different tests, with the secondary teaching test being harder as the level of teaching required would be more challenging due to GCSE's.

attributes.action: Add miscarriges into the secondary school sex education national curriculum
attributes.background: Last year I had two miscarriges (6 & 9 weeks). I felt so alone & was given limited information in the form of a leaflet from NHS staff. Everyone I told said ‘it happens to lots of women’, ‘at least you know you can conceive’ No one previously warned me about miscarriges or the signs and symptoms.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that miscarriages should be a part of the national curriculum to educate both boys and girls on how and why it happens and the emotional and physical toll it can take on both parents. It is such a taboo subject and yet if so many women experience it why don’t we talk about it so no one feels alone or unsure of their symptoms.

attributes.action: Enable ILR for Tier 2 Established Staff Visa which was issued before April 2011
attributes.background: As per the current rules, Tier 2 ICT Visa holders which was issued before April 2010 are eligible for ILR. In April 2010, rules have been changed and Tier 2 ICT Visa was given with the name as Established-Staff until April 2011. This Visa can be extended any number of times but not eligible for ILR.
attributes.additional_details: The rules have been changed again in 2011 to restructure the Tier 2 ICT Visas. Under these rules, Tier 2 ICT Visa holders who obtain Visa after April 2011 are eligible for settlement. This petition is for enabling ILR after completion of 5 years for Established-staff category Visa holders. As this Visa holders stayed in the country for more than 6 years, but not eligible for ILR under 5 year route. The number Visas issued between April 2010 and 2011 are very less and few people are remaining in the country right now. So, please enable ILR for Established staff category Visa holders under 5 year rule.
